unit_learning_outcomes.description: Compile and produce a practice log which records self-reflections on developing professional practice and learning.
Achieve a satisfactory level of progress in development as a provisional psychologist, in line with the requirements outlined in the professional field placement manual.
Implement communication skills effectively with clients and other professionals.
Apply decision-making strategies to resolve ethical questions to problems using the APS Code of Ethics, Guidelines and Mandatory reporting legislation, across a variety of contexts.
Explain the development of assessment, therapy and professional conduct within the organisational and independent contexts of professional psychological practice.
Implement and monitor the required number of supervised days of professional experience and the activities specified in the professional field placement manual for this unit.

enrolment_rules.description: (PSYP8901 or PSYP901) and (PSYP8902 or PSYP902) and (PSYP8903 or PSYP903)

assessments.description: End of Placement report completed by supervisor against goals across 300 hour placement.
Compile and produce a practice log which records their self-reflections on their developing professional practice and learning and achievement of goals.
Mid Placement progress report on report template completed by supervisor against goals across 300 hour placement.

data.unit_offering_text:
Full year 1, Weekday attendance, On location at placement
Session 2, Special circumstances, On location at placement
Session 2, Weekday attendance, On location at placement
Full year 1, Special circumstances, On location at placement

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit consists of one or more placements totalling 300 hours, in one or more professional psychology workplaces under the supervision of an Adjunct supervisor. It gives students the opportunity to apply the knowledge and skills developed in the program to real-world and professional practice situations as required by the accrediting body. This prepares the students for the 6th and final year of training and, in turn, registration and future, independent, professional practice.
data.title: Supervised Practical Placement
